episodeTitle: Zoan Type Devil's Fruit! Chopper's Seven-Level Transformation
episodeTitleJapanese: 動物（ゾオン）系悪魔の実！チョッパー七段変形
episodeTitleRomanized: Zoan-kei Akuma no Mi! Chopper Nanadan Henkei
description: Chopper consumes a Rumble Ball and demonstrates his seven transformations while battling the fused Chessmarimo. Meanwhile, Luffy plants Dr. Hiriluk's flag atop the castle tower as Wapol infiltrates the castle, and the Isshi-20 successfully revive the wounded Dalton.

events.title: Chessmarimo's First Appearance
events.description: Wapol uses his Baku Baku no Mi powers to devour Chess and Kuromarimo, fusing them into a single powerful fighter named Chessmarimo. This combined form emerges as a formidable opponent with the abilities of both subordinates merged.
events.significance: Demonstrates Wapol's Devil Fruit ability to combine people he has eaten, creating a stronger hybrid warrior. This is the first time viewers see this specific application of the Baku Baku no Mi's fusion powers.

events.title: Rumble Ball First Use
events.description: Tony Tony Chopper consumes a Rumble Ball for the first time in combat. He explains that this is a special drug he invented that distorts the wavelength of his Devil Fruit, allowing him to access seven different transformation forms instead of the usual three Zoan forms.
events.significance: Marks the debut of one of Chopper's signature abilities and demonstrates his pharmaceutical genius. The Rumble Ball becomes a crucial element of Chopper's fighting style throughout the series, showcasing his unique contribution as both a doctor and fighter.

quotes.text: This is a drug I created to enhance my Devil Fruit powers. With this Rumble Ball, I can access seven different transformation forms!
quotes.speaker: Chopper
quotes.context: Chopper explaining the Rumble Ball to his opponents before battle

events.title: Jump Point Debuts
events.description: Chopper transforms into Jump Point, a form optimized for agility and evasion. This slender, leg-focused transformation allows him to leap great distances and dodge Chessmarimo's attacks with incredible speed.
events.significance: First appearance of Jump Point, one of Chopper's Rumble Ball-enhanced forms. This transformation showcases the mobility-focused applications of his enhanced Zoan abilities.

events.title: Guard Point Debuts
events.description: Chopper transforms into Guard Point, a defensive ball-like form covered in thick fur that serves as impenetrable armor. He successfully blocks Chessmarimo's powerful attacks without taking damage.
events.significance: Introduction of Guard Point, Chopper's primary defensive transformation. This form becomes one of his most frequently used abilities for protection throughout the series.

events.title: Arm Point Debuts
events.description: Chopper shifts into Arm Point, a muscular transformation that enhances his physical strength. Using this form, he destroys Chessmarimo's hammer weapons with powerful punches.
events.significance: First showing of Arm Point, Chopper's offensive melee combat form. This transformation demonstrates his ability to match strength-based opponents.

events.title: Brain Point (Scope) Enhancement Revealed
events.description: Chopper uses an enhanced version of his Brain Point form to analyze Chessmarimo's body structure. With his increased intelligence and analytical abilities, he identifies the fusion's weak point - the chin where Chess and Kuromarimo are connected.
events.significance: Shows Brain Point's combat application beyond just being Chopper's cute form. Demonstrates his strategic thinking and medical knowledge used in battle.

quotes.text: I've found it! Your weak point is right there - where you two are connected!
quotes.speaker: Chopper
quotes.context: Chopper identifying Chessmarimo's weakness using Brain Point

events.title: Chopper Defeats Chessmarimo with Kokutei Roseo
events.description: After identifying the weak point, Chopper uses his Kokutei Roseo (Roseo Coloniale) technique - a powerful antler attack - to strike Chessmarimo's chin. The impact defeats the fusion, separating Chess and Kuromarimo.
events.significance: Chopper's first major solo victory in combat, proving his worth as a fighter and demonstrating his ability to combine strategic thinking with combat prowess. This battle showcases all aspects of the Rumble Ball's potential.

events.title: Luffy Plants Hiriluk's Flag
events.description: Monkey D. Luffy climbs to the top of Drum Castle's tallest tower and plants Dr. Hiriluk's pirate flag - a skull with cherry blossoms. This act honors the late doctor's memory and symbolizes the fulfillment of his dream.
events.significance: A deeply symbolic moment representing the respect for dreams and inherited will, core themes of One Piece. Luffy's action shows his understanding of what the flag means to Chopper and Kureha, honoring a man he never met because of what he stood for.

quotes.text: This flag will fly high! It's the symbol of a man's dream!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy declaring his intention to plant Hiriluk's flag

events.title: Wapol Infiltrates Drum Castle
events.description: While everyone is distracted by the ongoing battles, Wapol manages to secretly enter Drum Castle undetected, setting up the upcoming confrontation.
events.significance: Increases tension as the main antagonist positions himself for the arc's climax. Wapol's infiltration sets up his eventual confrontation with Luffy.

events.title: The Isshi-20 Reveal Their Change of Heart
events.description: The Isshi-20 doctors arrive and beg the townspeople to let them help save Dalton. They explain they had a change of heart after witnessing Dr. Hiriluk's death and now want to break free from Wapol to practice medicine for everyone.
events.significance: Shows the lasting impact of Hiriluk's sacrifice and how his death inspired others to stand up against tyranny. Demonstrates the ripple effect of one person's convictions.

quotes.text: We witnessed Dr. Hiriluk's sacrifice, and it opened our eyes. We can't serve Wapol anymore - we want to be real doctors again!
quotes.speaker: Isshi-20
quotes.context: The doctors explaining their motivation to help

events.title: Isshi-20 Successfully Revive Dalton
events.description: The Isshi-20 doctors use their combined medical expertise to treat and successfully revive Dalton, who was critically injured from the lapahn avalanche and severe frostbite. Though weakened, Dalton regains consciousness.
events.significance: Dalton's revival allows him to continue his role as leader and protector of Drum Island. The successful treatment demonstrates the Isshi-20's skill and their genuine return to being true doctors.

events.title: Dalton Declares He Must Confront Wapol
events.description: Despite being severely weakened from his injuries, Dalton insists on going to confront Wapol. He storms out of his medical treatment, driven by his duty to protect the people of Drum Island.
events.significance: Shows Dalton's unwavering dedication to his people and his sense of responsibility as their guardian, even at the cost of his own health and recovery.

quotes.text: I still have to stand up to Wapol! The people need me!
quotes.speaker: Dalton
quotes.context: Dalton refusing to rest after being revived

events.title: Zoro and Usopp Transport Dalton
events.description: Roronoa Zoro and Usopp assist in transporting the recovering but weakened Dalton toward the mountain where Drum Castle is located, helping him reach the battlefield despite his injuries.
events.significance: Demonstrates the Straw Hats' willingness to help the people of Drum Island and their respect for Dalton's determination. Shows team cooperation in supporting local allies.

themes.description: The episode emphasizes how Dr. Hiriluk's sacrifice and dreams continue to inspire others even after his death. His flag flies above the castle, and the Isshi-20 doctors are motivated to change their ways after witnessing his final moments.
themes.symbolism: Hiriluk's pirate flag with cherry blossoms represents both his dream of healing hearts and his pirate spirit of freedom. Luffy planting this flag shows respect for inherited dreams.
culturalReferences: Cherry blossoms (sakura) as symbols of beauty, renewal, and the ephemeral nature of life in Japanese culture

themes.description: Chopper's first real combat experience forces him to use all his abilities creatively. Though inexperienced, he combines his medical knowledge, strategic thinking, and Devil Fruit powers to overcome a stronger opponent.
themes.symbolism: The seven transformations represent Chopper's versatility and his unique approach to combat that combines science, medicine, and fighting ability.

themes.description: The Isshi-20 doctors seek redemption for serving Wapol's tyranny. Inspired by Hiriluk's sacrifice, they choose to return to their true calling as healers who serve all people.
themes.symbolism: Saving Dalton's life represents their genuine return to being true doctors rather than tools of oppression.

characterSpotlights.development: Chopper demonstrates his combat potential for the first time, showing he's not just a doctor but a capable fighter. His use of the Rumble Ball and strategic thinking in battle proves his value as both a scientist and warrior.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime expands on the Chopper vs Chessmarimo fight with additional transformation sequences and combat choreography not present in the manga.
Additional scenes of the Isshi-20 treating Dalton with more medical detail were added in the anime.

trivia.fact: Episode 88 aired on November 18, 2001, exactly three years after Chapter 88 of the manga was published.
This episode marks the first time a Rumble Ball is used in the anime. Chopper spent five years developing this drug while living on Drum Island.
The episode achieved a 15.3% TV rating in Japan, ranking 5th for the week, demonstrating strong viewership during the Drum Island arc.
Ikue Otani, who voices Chopper, is also famous for voicing Pikachu in the Pokémon anime series.
Chessmarimo only appears in this one episode before being defeated, making it one of the shortest-lived fusion characters in One Piece.
